meanings.definition: Inclined to vindicate or revenge; revengeful.
meanings.sent1: She was very vindicative towards those who wronged her.
meanings.sent2: His vindicative nature often led to conflicts with others.
meanings.sent3: The vindicative cat knocked over the vase in retaliation for being ignored.
meanings.sent4: Her vindicative glare made it clear she would not forget the betrayal.
meanings.sent5: The stormy sky mirrored her vindicative mood perfectly.

meanings.sent1: The evidence presented was vindicative of his innocence.
meanings.sent2: Her vindicative actions helped clear his name in the end.
meanings.sent3: The vindicative reasoning behind his decision surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The vindicative nature of the data supported his theory completely.
meanings.sent5: The vindicative tone in her voice left no room for doubt.
